content: Which former U.S. president was an accomplished peanut farmer before entering politics?

I believe the former U.S. president you're referring to is Jimmy Carter. He was the 39th President of the United States, serving from 1977 to 1981. Before his political career, Carter was indeed an accomplished peanut farmer. He took over his family's farm in Plains, Georgia, after serving in the Navy. His experience as a farmer shaped his perspective and policies during his presidency, particularly in agriculture and rural development.
